summary: This bill, the House Expansion Commission Act, establishes a commission to study and develop proposals for expanding the size of the U.S. House of Representatives. The commission will examine the current size's impact on representation, consider different expansion methods, assess the logistical and financial implications, and consult various officials. The commission will submit a report with proposals to the President and Congress within two years, including ways to bolster the House's role in representing the American people.
